page.title: 07NATURE RESERVES CONSERVATION
page.content: The School nature reserve of about \HA was created by Jack Doyle, Head of Geology, and is dedicated to Mr.E.J.Douglas, the first headmaster of Hadham Hall and a keen naturalist. There are three chalk mounds and one acid mound, and a marshy area. Interesting plants include, common spotted orchid, southern marsh orchid ,twyblade adders tongue fern, yellow rattle, horseshoe vetch, greater broom rape and knapweed. Slowworms, frogs, toads and butterflies such as small and larger skipper, ringlets, meadow brown, hedge brown, gatekeeper are found here. Ilpunde Wood has many fairly rare species of plants and animals including pyramid orchid, autumn gentian and roman snails. It is hoped that it may become a SSI.
